regulationsummary: The Ordinance establishes comprehensive antimoney laundering and counterterrorist financing obligations for financial institutions, insurers, money service operators, virtual asset service providers, and other designated nonfinancial businesses It requires customer due diligence CDD, recordkeeping for highvalue storedvalue facilities, and enhanced due diligence EDD for specified highrisk DNFBPs The Ordinance empowers relevant authorities to supervise compliance, conduct inspections, and enforce penalties, while providing guidelines to clarify operational requirements It also sets out procedures for investigations, evidence handling, and crossjurisdictional cooperation on virtual asset activities Noncompliance can lead to substantial fines, imprisonment, and disciplinary actions

actionablerules.obligation: Collect and verify the identity of every customer, the source of funds, and the purpose of the transaction before opening an account or providing a service
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All financial institutions, insurers, licensed money service operators, licensed VAS providers, TCSP licensees, and Category B PMS registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Customers who provide anonymous or incomplete identification documents
Transactions involving unusually large amounts or rapid movement of funds
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Copy of governmentissued ID or passport
Proof of address utility bill, bank statement
Source of funds documentation salary slips, business invoices
Internal CDD policy and training records
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the customer is a highrisk individual or the transaction involves highrisk jurisdictions, complex ownership structures, or is otherwise suspicious

actionablerules.obligation: Maintain complete records of all storedvalue facility transactions where the maximum value stored exceeds HK3,000 and the value is stored on a physical device
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: SVF licensees and banks operating storedvalue facilities
risksignalstomonitor: Frequent cash deposits or withdrawals exceeding HK3,000
Multiple small deposits that aggregate to a large amount structuring
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Transaction logs with customer details, date, amount, and purpose
Device serial numbers and ownership records
Periodic audit reports of storedvalue balances
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard recordkeeping suffices EDD is triggered only if the transaction is otherwise suspicious

actionablerules.obligation: Apply enhanced due diligence to DNFBPs when they conduct transactions involving real estate, securities, trust or company services, or other highrisk activities
whoitappliesto: Licensed individual insurance agents, insurance agencies, and insurance broker companies
Licensed VAS providers and their associated entities
risksignalstomonitor: Transactions involving offshore entities or shell companies
Complex ownership structures with no clear beneficial owner
Highvalue transactions with no clear economic rationale
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Beneficial ownership statements
Detailed transaction purpose and source of funds
Periodic review of the DNFBPs client base and transaction patterns
Internal EDD policy and audit trail
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is mandatory for all DNFBPs when they are involved in the specified highrisk transactions

actionablerules.obligation: Flag and investigate any transaction that is unusual, involves highrisk jurisdictions, or shows structuring or rapid movement of funds
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All regulated entities subject to the Ordinance
risksignalstomonitor: Structuring smurfing of deposits or withdrawals
Rapid transfer of funds between accounts or jurisdictions
Transactions with no clear business or economic purpose
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Suspicious transaction reports STRs filed with the relevant authority
Internal investigation logs and findings
Evidence of source of funds and transaction purpose
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the transaction is flagged as suspicious, EDD must be performed on the customer and the transaction

actionablerules.obligation: Implement and maintain policies and procedures that incorporate any guidelines issued by the Monetary Authority, Securities and Futures Commission, Insurance Authority, or other relevant regulatory bodies
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All regulated entities covered by the Ordinance
risksignalstomonitor: Lack of documented policies or outdated procedures
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Copies of all relevant guidelines and the institutions internal policy documents
Records of staff training on guidelines
Audit reports confirming adherence to guidelines
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this rule governs standard compliance EDD is triggered by other risk indicators

actionablerules.obligation: Cooperate with investigations, provide requested records, and pay any pecuniary penalties imposed by relevant authorities
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All regulated entities, including financial institutions, insurers, VAS providers, and DNFBPs
risksignalstomonitor: Failure to respond to inspection requests
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Acknowledgement of inspection or investigation requests
Copies of records produced to investigators
Payment receipts for any fines or penalties
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this rule addresses enforcement and compliance, not due diligence
